children.subject: i think 61c + c100 + stat140 + cs61b is roughly 2-3 times more workload than 70 and 16b imo

history.content:
This schedule will be incredibly time consuming, and is definitely going to be more than double your current workload of 70 and 16B.

I'm taking 61C and Data 100 right now with 70, and it's definitely a lot of work, but doable with enough time management.

I took 61B with Hilfinger, and I would not underestimate the difficulty of his projects-- they are far more time consuming than Hug's projects. 

61C is also project heavy, and definitely goes quite fast. It might be a good idea to wait till you've taken 61B before taking 61C.

Data 100 is also definitely a much harder class than Data 8, and the professors are making it harder, like adding more concepts like PCA into the curriculum. 

Stat 140 is also a much deeper dive into the probability portion of 70, and I've heard 70 doesn't really help for the 2nd half of the course.

I would definitely try to drop at least one of these courses (imo 61C).

If you were to take all 4, yes 61B is the class you should Phase 2. They usually expand to accommodate everyone, though last Fall there were some enrollment issues given that 61B assumes less people take the class in the Fall.

children.subject: It's almost never worth it to cram 4 techs in like this. I would push Stat 140 back one semester to allow yourself to continue to build mathematical maturity. Burnout, especially with schedules like this, is a real problem @ Cal -- its not like just 3 of those classes will be any less of a challenge, so I would recommend reconsidering.

140, 186, 188 sounds reasonable. Add in 170 and you're no longer in reasonable territory. At the end of the day it's up to you, but not taking every single class that you want to is definitely preferable (if I was in your shoes) to getting destroyed by school semester after semester.

What easy technicals are left that I can combine as a 4th class?  I have 13 classes to go, all technicals.  By my math, I’m going to have to take 4 technicals at least one semester and if I include CS61B, that’s 2 semesters of 4 technicals. No plans for summer school.

My list:
DS:

Data 100
Stat 140
Cogsci 131
CS 188
CS 189 (or DS 102)

CS:
61C
170
186
162
164
169
2 electives, thinking about Info 154 and info 159 but too bad neither is offered in Fall 2019

The best 4 at once is likely DS100, 186, 188, Cogsci  131/DS102. Note that I'm just assuming Cogsci is easier than the majority of CS classes but I really don't know. The 3 CS classes listed 100/186/188 are probably the "easiest" CS upper divs that exist though.

thanks for the responses.

So if I pushed back either STAT 140 or CS 61C, I'm guessing Spring 2020 might look something like this:

CS 61C/STAT140, 170, 186, 188.  How doable is this?  I feel like if I keep pushing back, I'll run out of semesters.

I probably would want to take 162, 164, 169, 189 and 2 more electives (maybe 3) the following year, my final year.

history.content:
so a few weeks ago I had posted a thread on a slightly different courseload here - @8908

I've sort of decided (still can change my mind in the next 2 weeks) to replace CS170 with CS61B.  Now I don't need to take the class since I took the Data Structures class in HS in community college and it was a really good class, but everyone is telling me that retaking the 61B class is very important as a foundational prereq to all the upper div classes, so I'm going to listen.  I really was hoping to get started with upper divs for CS (halfway there with DS already) so that I can graduate after Spring of 2021, but I guess I'll have to squeeze all the upper divs into 3 semesters.

The question I still have is whether I'm gonna get any sleep in the Fall since it sounds like all 4 classes involve heavy programming projects.  My understanding is that 61B with Prof Hilfiger is heavy with projects (which I like, I prefer projects emphasis to exams way more).  STAT 140 will be time consuming, though I'll have suffered through 70, so hopefully STAT 140 won't be too bad.  Data 8 was really easy and I'm hearing C100 is not too bad.  Haven't heard much about workload with Prof Garcia though for 61C, though I'm guessing it will be heavy.  I feel like 4 technicals shouldn't be that big of an issue since I'm a decent programmer, but I may have to cut out most or all of my ECs.  (I'm taking 70 and 16B this semester which I'm doing ok in.  It's the other 2 somewhat non-techs that involve a lot of writing that's killing me actually).

Also, I'll assume it's pretty safe to Phase II CS61B? Berkeleytime shows that 61B is less popular in the Fall which makes sense.
history.subject: CS61C+C100+STAT140+CS61B
